column4: how to ping my other pc?? so i don't have to keep switching my monitor and keybord and mouse back and forth??
doesn't sound like the ping command is what you are looking for
this is one computer you want to manipulate, correct>
aha, you have serverA with a connection to the internet and serverB that wants to connect directly to serverA and access the internet?
follow the above link. that require iptables rules
typically you'll plug your laptop into a router/switch and dhcp will give you an address
in the situation you describe you need to manually set serverB's IP address and route
the fix is simple.  you just need to set an iptables jump route for the serverB computer. google, or firestarter can help you make those configs. in reality it is a one line iptables command
the default gw on serverB is the the same default gw that server1 has
I don't have the command handy. what I am saying is you need to make an iptable rule that forwards traffic from the same network you serverB is on to the default gw on serverA
you probably need to add the route also. google will help you, I can't
you must setup an iptables rule on serverA to forward traffic to the default gateway from serverB's network
iptables is beyon the scope of my help here
but you should be able to google up a solution
you mentioned slave computers, I assumed those are samba shares?
